intro: Perezia wislizeni var. megacephala, commonly known as the giant head perezia, is a striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, umbrella-like inflorescence composed of numerous white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid environments, such as rocky soils in desert regions. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with long, slender segments that help reduce water loss. The species is notable for its unique floral structure and is often found in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico.
